sentence.text: Patient 6 is the younger brother of Patient 5.
He was his parents’ second pregnancy.
Short limbs were seen on prenatal ultrasound and he was delivered at term by cesarean (see Fig. 1; Tables I and ​andII).II).
A submucous cleft palate was present.
Early on, he was recognized as having the same syndromic condition as his brother.
Delayed development is present and necessitated special education programs.
Dislocating patellae are present as is significant genua vara and a limb length discrepancy.
Abnormal progression of digital lengths was noted with shortened 4th and relatively elongated 3rd digits noted on the right side.
Additionally, he has esotropia with left hypertropia and strabismus, a high pitched voice, and sleep apnea.
Chronic joint pain and morbid obesity were also a concern.
